2.24.24  2:33 am   How do you record all the parts of your music? Do you just play them all separately to a metronome or something, because that's what I'm thinking about doing.

Â Â Â Â Â  yes

2.24.24  2:01 am   Do you consciously believe in the significance of aesthetic for art?

Â Â Â Â Â sure

      A fundamental feeling that permeates through all aspects of it?

Â Â Â Â Â oh that's not what i thought aesthetic meant, but that's nice too

      I think you've achieved an aesthetic through being yourself. Maybe this is the only way you can. But it's interesting because I've started a music project with a friend and everything, the name of the duo, the feelings of the music we're writing, the name of the album in development, all of it feels right together. Do you have any thoughts about this?

Â Â Â Â Â that sounds like destiny

2.24.24  1:42 am   do you feel like you are mysterious?

Â Â Â Â Â sometimes

     why or why not?

Â Â Â Â Â the nay sayers will probably never believe this, but it can be a pretty good marketing strategy

2.23.24  5:42 pm   what's the thought process usually going into all the little visual gags in the videos for your songs?
as an example, "use a bike to escape the grid" from and the day goes on, to me it feels like it might be trying to communicate a specific feeling, but it may also have just been added cause it's a funny and unique visual

Â Â Â Â Â just common sense

Â Â Â Â Â  0/O

2.23.24  4:05 pm   this is a weird specific one but i'd been like depressed for like years wont get into it but one of the debilitating symptoms was just being completely unable to plan for the future, or even conceptualize of "future" itself at all. you put out your tune "if the world doesn't end" right as i was on the cusp of starting to do better, i think i teared up the first time i heard it because it resonated with me so immensely? especially "we'll have fun, and learn about the future and each other and make plans again", the melody is so sweet during that part too.

then just now in 2023 i started to get much much better, i'm excited about stuff, i'm making plans for the future for the first time in forever and everything. and the song is still in my playlists and everytime i hear it it's just been feeling more and more real. isn't that fun, i got to take that song of yours on a little journey with me

Â Â Â Â Â  oh hi

2.23.24  8:20 am   Sometimes I see questions that have already been answered get posted on this site, and occasionally you give word-for-word the same response you did before. Do you copy/paste when you see it, or are you just very consistent?

I'm not talking about the questions with small answers, like "I would prefer to make a new one to be my favourite", I mean the longer ones that are harder to get exactly the same.

Â Â Â Â Â  i've experimented with all different kinds of methods. often, the same question will indeed have the same answer. so i may use the same answer. however, it's also good to challenge myself to find a new answer each time. but then again, after doing that 10 times it may be difficult to find an 11th different answer to a question whose answer genuinely remains the same

2.23.24  8:01 am   What's your favourite piano pedal

Â Â Â Â Â  i forgot the name of it because it's lasted so long

2.23.24  6:54 am   So far I've just been humming melodies and then using trial and error to transcribe them into piano roll.
But, I think if I want to take this stuff further, I gotta buy a midi keyboard and teach myself how to play piano.

Since you're self-taught and are a avid midi user (i think), do you have any advice??


Also, how does one CHORDS?!?! All I know at the moment is that I can create major & minor chords and mish-mash them into a sequence, but I have no idea where to go from here, the world of chords seems so daunting...

Â Â Â Â Â  if you get a keyboard this will all become apparent. just be careful to get one that knows the difference between how loud you played each note. if not this will unwittingly tamper your spirit unnecessarily
